help_texts: Are you ready to begin your adventure? Answer in Ruby.
In Ruby, we say things are 'truthy' or correct when they are true.
We often use true to say yes, as well
Try telling Ruby that it is 'true' that you want to begin your adventure.
Now give me the name Gandalf as a String.
Let me know your name by assigning it to a variable called '@name'!

Variables hold information. We use the equal sign to assign information into a variable:
@name = "Matt"
In this case, we want to assign the value of your name, as a string, to the variable @name.
I think you might like reading about variables: http://mislav.uniqpath.com/poignant-guide/book/chapter-3.html#section2
Now send the string 'sevraq' to the translate method.
We say that we are sending a message to an object when we invoke a method.

You can send a message to an object like this:
 object.method(parameters)
